item.title: 温和的美国 6 月 CPI 为美联储宽松政策铺平道路
item.description: 美国 6 月份消费者物价意外下降，年增幅为一年来最小，这强化了通货紧缩趋势重回正轨的观点，使美联储距离降息又近了一步。【原文：U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly fell in June and the annual increase was the smallest in a year, reinforcing views that the disinflation trend was back on track and drawing the Federal Reserve another step closer to cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 雷神公司赢得 12 亿美元合同，向德国提供更多爱国者防空导弹防御系统
item.description: RTX 旗下的雷神技术公司（Raytheon Technologies）周四表示，该公司已获得一份价值 12 亿美元的合同，将为德国提供更多的 "爱国者 "防空和导弹防御系统。【原文：RTX's Raytheon Technologies said on Thursday that it has been awarded a $1.2 billion contract to supply Germany with additional Patriot air and missile defense systems.】

item.title: 贝恩资本将以 45 亿美元收购金融软件供应商 Envestnet
item.description: 金融软件供应商 Envestnet 周四表示，私募股权公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）将以 45 亿美元的价格收购 Envestnet，贝莱德（BlackRock）和富达投资（Fidelity Investments）等一批投资者也将提供支持。【原文：Private equity firm Bain Capital will buy Envestnet in a $4.5 billion deal, with backing from a cohort of investors, including BlackRock and Fidelity Investments, the financial software vendor said on Thursday.】

item.title: 分析师称，区块投资者需要更多信息来衡量加密货币部门的盈利潜力
item.description: 杰克-多西（Jack Dorsey）领导的支付技术公司布洛克（Block）可能会成为加密货币挖矿行业的强大参与者，但分析师表示，华尔街需要了解利润率方面的详细信息，以衡量这项业务带来的盈利尾风。【原文：Jack Dorsey-led payments technology firm Block could become a formidable player in the crypto mining industry, but Wall Street will need details on profit margins to gauge the earnings tailwind from this business, analysts said.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数降幅超过预期
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量降幅超过预期，但由于汽车制造商闲置工厂进行改造，每年这个时候都会出现波动，因此很难对劳动力市场做出准确判断。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits dropped more than expected last week, but volatility around this time of the year as automobile manufacturers idle plants for retooling makes it harder to get a clean read on the labor market.】

item.title: CPI数据公布后，交易员加大对美联储9月降息的押注
item.description: 周三，在一份政府报告显示6月份通胀率下降后，交易员们加大了对美联储将于9月份开始降息的押注。 利率期货价格显示，美联储在9月份会议上降息的可能性约为85%，而在报告公布前，降息的可能性约为70%。交易商还【原文：Traders on Wednesday boosted bets that the Federal Reserve will start cutting rates in September after a government report showed inflation receding in June. Interest-rate futures prices reflected about an 85% chance of a rate cut at the Fed's September meeting, compared with about a 70% chance seen before the report, which showed consumer prices unexpectedly fell last month from May. Traders also】

item.title: 美国 6 月消费者价格意外下降
item.description: 美国消费者物价意外下降，年增幅为一年来最小，这强化了通货紧缩趋势重回正轨的观点，使美联储距离降息又近了一步。【原文：U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly fell and the annual increase was the smallest in a year, reinforcing views that the disinflation trend was back on track and drawing the Federal Reserve another step closer to cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 调查显示，投资组合经理预计第三季度信贷状况恶化
item.description: 国际信贷组合经理协会的一项调查显示，全球最大金融机构的投资组合经理预计未来三个月信贷状况将恶化。【原文：Portfolio managers at the world's largest global financial institutions expect credit conditions to worsen over the next three months, according to a survey by the International Association of Credit Portfolio Managers.】

item.title: 由于需求不振，Conagra Brands 预计全年有机销售额低于预期
item.description: 康奈格拉品牌公司（Conagra Brands）周四预计全年营收低于预期，原因是生活成本居高不下继续拖累销售量，导致资金紧张的购物者转而选择更便宜的家庭用餐替代品。【原文：Conagra Brands forecast annual revenue below estimates on Thursday, as cash-strapped shoppers turned to cheaper alternatives for their at-home meals as high living costs continued to weigh on sales volumes.】

item.title: 贸易公司从英国石油公司和壳牌石油公司吸引顶尖人才
item.description: 多位消息人士周四告诉路透社，最近几周，几位知名的能源交易员从石油巨头公司辞职，转投贸易公司，因为资产易手后人才流失，贸易公司也在增加奖金。【原文：Several high-profile energy traders have in recent weeks quit oil majors for trading houses, multiple sources told Reuters on Thursday, as talent follows assets swapping hands and as trading houses ramp up bonuses.】

item.title: 大众汽车通过 QuantumScape 交易提高固态电池产量
item.description: 大众汽车公司与美国初创公司 QuantumScape 周四表示，大众汽车将大幅提高与 QuantumScape 合作开发的固态电池的产量，因为这家德国汽车制造商的目标是将这种技术应用到更多的汽车上。【原文：Volkswagen will massively ramp up production of solid-state batteries developed with U.S. startup QuantumScape , both companies said on Thursday, as the German carmaker aims to bring the technology into more vehicles.】

item.title: 达美航空盈利前景弱于华尔街预期
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周四预计，本季度利润将低于分析师预期，原因是低端市场面临折扣压力。【原文：Delta Air Lines on Thursday forecast lower profits in the current quarter than analysts had expected, with the carrier citing discounting pressure in the low end of the market.】

item.title: 摩根大通旨在积累 15%的美国消费者存款，提高信用卡份额
item.description: 美国最大的银行希望变得更大。【原文：The biggest U.S. bank wants to get even bigger.】

item.title: 在通胀数据考验涨势之前，期货走低
item.description: 华尔街期货周四下滑，因为市场正在为一项关键的美国通胀数据做准备，该数据可能会增强美国联邦储备委员会放宽政策的预期，并使股市继续保持破纪录的上涨势头。【原文：Wall Street futures slipped on Thursday as markets braced for a key U.S. inflation print that could bolster expectations of policy easing from the U.S. Federal Reserve and keep equities on their record-breaking run.】

item.title: 印度 TCS 第一季度收入超出预期
item.description: 塔塔咨询服务公司（Tata Consultancy Services）是印度最大的 IT 服务公司，该公司周四公布的第一季度营收超过预期，主要得益于前几个季度大宗交易的执行。【原文：Tata Consultancy Services , India's top IT services company, reported a bigger-than-expected first-quarter revenue on Thursday helped by execution of large deals bagged in previous quarters.】

item.title: 百事公司因零食和汽水需求放缓导致季度收入不及预期
item.description: 百事公司（PepsiCo）周四公布的第二季度营收不及预期，原因是该公司的零食和苏打水需求疲软，主要集中在其最大的市场美国。【原文：PepsiCo missed expectations for second-quarter revenue on Thursday as it faced weak demand for its snacks and sodas mainly in the U.S., its largest market.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）被提名人将就机构和银行监管问题接受质询
item.description: 克里斯蒂-戈德史密斯-罗梅罗（Christy Goldsmith Romero）周四在参议院接受质询时，预计将被问及她是否具备全面改革丑闻缠身的联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）和监管全国银行的经验。【原文：Christy Goldsmith Romero is expected to be grilled on whether she has the experience to overhaul the scandal-hit Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and oversee the nation's banks when she appears before the Senate on Thursday.】

item.title: 高盛不断扩张但风险重重的融资引擎内幕
item.description: 2021 年，高盛（Goldman Sachs）在向私人基金提供贷款方面下了赌注，这有助于推动固定收益融资收入创下新高。现在，这家华尔街银行正在进一步深入这个不断增长但风险巨大的市场。【原文：A Goldman Sachs bet put in place in 2021 on lending to private funds has helped drive record revenues in fixed-income financing. Now, the Wall Street bank is pushing even deeper into the growing but risky market.】

item.title: 法国迪卡侬旨在通过交易在不断发展的体育市场上壮大规模
item.description: 法国体育用品零售商迪卡侬首席执行官芭芭拉-马丁-科波拉（Barbara Martin Coppola）表示，大流行后的行业洗牌使许多公司成为有吸引力的目标，迪卡侬正在寻找专业品牌以扩大业务。【原文：French sports retailer Decathlon is shopping for specialist brands to expand its business, capitalising on a post-pandemic shakeout in the industry that has made many firms attractive targets, CEO Barbara Martin Coppola said.】

item.title: 早间竞价：对 CPI 持谨慎态度似乎不是障碍，英镑大涨
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Codelco 努力提高铜产量，摆脱 25 年来的低点
item.description: 智利国有矿业巨头 Codelco 公司的铜产量在去年创下 25 年新低后仍在下滑，挤压了本已紧张的全球红色金属市场。【原文：Copper output at Chile state mining giant Codelco is still slumping after hitting a 25-year low last year, squeezing an already tight global market for the red metal that is in growing demand for electric vehicles and the green energy revolution.】

item.title: 监管机构称，Grab 收购新加坡出租车公司的交易可能会削弱竞争
item.description: 纳斯达克上市的叫车公司 Grab 收购新加坡私营出租车公司 Trans-cab Holdings 的交易可能会导致当地市场的竞争大幅减少，新加坡竞争监督机构周四表示。【原文：Nasdaq-listed ride hailing company Grab's deal to buy Singapore's private taxi firm Trans-cab Holdings is likely to result in substantial lessening of competition in the local market, the city-state's competition watchdog said on Thursday.】

item.title: 监察机构称亚马逊可能因对待英国杂货供应商而面临调查
item.description: 英国食品杂货监管机构周四威胁亚马逊，如果不改善其遵守旨在保护供应商的行业准则的情况，将对其进行正式调查。【原文：Britain's grocery regulator on Thursday threatened Amazon with a formal investigation if it does not improve its compliance with an industry code designed to protect suppliers.】

item.title: 苹果将允许竞争对手使用 "即点即付 "支付，避免欧盟反垄断罚款
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构周四表示，苹果公司将向竞争对手开放其 "即点即付 "移动支付系统，从而结束了长达四年之久的调查。【原文：Apple will open its tap-and-go mobile payments system to rivals, EU antitrust regulators said on Thursday, ending a four-year long investigation that could have resulted in a hefty fine for the iPhone maker.】

item.title: 拜登政府将向 Stellantis 和通用汽车提供近 11 亿美元用于电动汽车生产
item.description: 拜登政府周四表示，计划向通用汽车和克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特公司提供近 11 亿美元的补助金，用于改造现有工厂，以生产电动汽车和零部件。【原文：The Biden administration plans to award General Motors and Chrysler-parent Stellantis nearly $1.1 billion in grants to convert existing plants to build electric vehicles and components, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本股市创下近六个月来最大单周外资流入记录
item.description: 截至 7 月 5 日的一周内，受市场反弹和对下半年企业稳健盈利前景的乐观情绪推动，外国投资者对日本股票进行了大量投资。【原文：Foreign investors made hefty investments in Japanese stocks in the week ended July 5, driven by a market rally and optimism over the outlook for solid corporate earnings in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 英国皇家特许测量师学会调查显示：英国房地产市场持续低迷，但乐观情绪有所增强
item.description: 周四的一项调查显示，6月份英国住房市场依然疲软，但调查人员对本月议会选举后的前景持更加积极的态度，而且利率可能会下降。【原文：Britain's housing market remained soft in June but surveyors were more positive about the outlook following this month's parliamentary elections and with interest rates likely to fall, a survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国降息押注稳固，亚洲外汇熊市缓和
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，由于对美国联邦储备委员会今年至少降息两次的预期升温以及美元走软提振了风险情绪，大多数亚洲货币的空头头寸有所缓解。【原文：Short positions on most Asian currencies eased, as rising expectations of at least two rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve this year and an easing dollar boosted risk sentiment, a Reuters poll found on Thursday.】

item.title: 目标冲突阻碍中国全会制定政策议程
item.description: 中国领导人将在下周举行的一次备受瞩目的会议上寻求为经济注入信心，但在促进增长的同时削减债务等相互冲突的目标可能意味着在实施变革方面进展甚微。【原文：China's leaders will seek to inject confidence in the economy at a highly anticipated meeting next week, but conflicting goals, such as boosting growth while cutting debt, may mean little progress toward implementing change.】

item.title: 必和必拓将暂停西澳大利亚镍矿业务
item.description: 澳大利亚矿商必和必拓集团（BHP Group）周四表示，由于受到金属价格暴跌和全球市场供过于求的影响，该公司将从10月起暂时停止西部镍矿的运营和西马斯格雷夫项目。【原文：Australia's BHP Group will temporarily suspend its Nickel West operations and West Musgrave project from October, the miner said on Thursday, as it reels from a plunge in metal prices and an oversupply in the global market.】
